messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] To Cathie
messages.msgSnippet: Cathie,  thank you for your reply.  How long has Megan been unschooling? Katrina has almost no internet experience, but she is beginning to show some interest.
messages.messageBody:
Cathie, thank you for your reply. How long has Megan been unschooling?

Katrina has almost no internet experience, but she is beginning to show some
interest. One of the big results of being labeled in school was being
isolated and often scapegoated, so she has real anxiety about other kids.
We have tried to artificially create situations where she could be
successful, but her anxiety is so overwhelming that these ended in failure,
too. I think it's possible that meeting others on the internet could really
help. I will help her get her an internet address of her own in the next
week, and please, if Megan could write her that would be great.

Cathy


From: Cathie _ <cathie_98@...>


>
> She also spent tons of time on the internet. She has made some really good
> friends that way-in fact, she is now in Wisconsin on a campout with a
bunch
> of these kids. She also learned more social studies than she ever did in
> school just by talking to kids from other countries. She did alot with
kids
> from Holland. She could tell me all about the country, not just dry
> statistics, but what they learned in school, how much internet service and
> houses and stuff cost, what the weather is like, things people do there,
> crime and local news. She knew time zones around the world-she could tell
> where someone was by the time on their icq message. It took me pointing
out
> to her that this was educational-turning it into educational lingo-to show
> her that when she was having fun she was doing school.
>
> If your daughter would like to meet her, let me know. She will be back
from
> Wisconsin in another week, and I'm sure she would be glad to email your
> girl.
>
> Cathie
>
